result.execSummary:
Derek J. Foster was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Derek J. Foster was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek J. Foster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:38 pm - Defendant Derek J. Foster in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA files original State of WI Governor's warrant along with State of Minnesota paperwork.  Court informs DE of Minnesota charges. Comments by Atty. Willett. DE does not wish to challenge Governor's warrant. Court questions DE regarding true name.  DE has received copy of Governor's warrant. Exam by Court. Court orders DE remanded to Price County Sheriff's Dept. for transport to Minnesota.  Court orders bond revoked and returned. Adj. 2:44 pm.

10:30 am - Defendant Derek J. Foster appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states receipt of extradition paperwork from Governor's office via email. Original to follow in the mail.  Court orders bond to continue. Comments and questions by Atty. Willett. Response by Court. Comments by DA. Adj. 10:35 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Sarah Foster.  Defendant may not leave Price County without prior approval of the Court.

8:31 am - Defendant Derek J. Foster appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states status of extradition and requests extension of three weeks. So ordered.  Court addresses Atty. Willett's motion to modify bond.  No objection by DA. So ordered. Adj. 8:33 am.

9:30 am - Defendant Derek J. Foster appeared with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by DA. Exam by Court. Court finds defendant is the individual wanted in another state and orders bond to remain in effect. 30 days to await Governor's warrant. To be set for status. Adj. 9:34 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may have no contact with Sarah Foster. Defendant may not have contact with N.F. nor go upon residence at W2725 Levine Dr., Ogema or any other residence occupied by N.F. in the future, May not leave Price County without prior approval of the Court.

1:45 pm - Defendant Derek J. Foster in court with attorney Stephen D Willett.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Extradition hearing to be held at a later date. DA moves to remand defendant to department without bond. Response by Atty. Willett. Exam by Court. Further comment by DA. Further comment by Atty. Willett. Comments and ruling by Court. Bond set for 30 days. Further comments by DA to add additional no contacts to bond. Response by Atty. WIllett. Further comments by parties. Court states order. Adj. 2:00 pm.
